message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM. 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating 3D human pose and shape from a single image, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV). The approach involves training a ConvNet to predict Part-Centric Heatmap Triplets (HEMlets) and using them to estimate the 3D pose and shape of the human body. This involves regression and learning, which are common themes in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also deals with the problem of generalization to "in-the-wild" images, which involves dealing with real-world scenarios and outdoor environments, which could fall under computer graphics (cs.GR) or multimedia (cs.MM).
